results.title: Intimations talks to Richard Lester
results.brief_description: Malcolm Muggeridge talks to American born film director Richard Lester about the experiences and influences that have affected his work and his decision to give up psychology for the cinema and the nature of filmmaking. His films include “Running, Jumping, Standing Still” nominated for an Academy Award and first prize at the San Francisco Film Festival; “The Knack” which won the Palm D’Or at Cannes; the Beatles films “A Hard Day’s Night” and “Help” which shared the Grand Prix in the Rio Festival. In addition he has written many songs and scripts and directed several hundred commercials. He also talks about the influence of his parents, and slapstick comedy and its appeal as a reaction to an ordered, mercantile society.

results.title: Interviewing: the process
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how decision analysis techniques can be used to achieve objective evaluations in a range of situations, such a personnel recruitment interviews, product evaluation, customer service evaluation. A manual complements the video and may be loaned as a separate item.

results.title: Interviewing and hiring: getting it right the first time
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, Clifton Hill Productions and The Public Record
results.brief_description: The importance of selecting the right person for the job and the implications to your business if you don’t are highlighted in this 30 minute video. The 4 classic mistakes that hirers make - failure to fully read and understand the candidate’s CV, poor questioning techniques in the interview, excessive talking by the interviewer, and inadequate verification with previous employers - are clearly explained by presenter Sandy Kaye and illustrated through live footage. Covers issues such as job titles, exaggerated claims, education and training, references and testimonials and the importance of open and behavioural questioning. A complimentary participants guide accompanies the video which allows pausing between each mistake addressed. Whilst aimed at employers/interviewers this video is equally useful for job seekers who want to know how to conduct oneself in an interview. Written by Bruce Storey.

results.title: Interview with Linus Pauling
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Hugh O'Connor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A stimulating and provocative hour with Dr. Linus Pauling, eminent American chemist and Nobel Prize winner in 1954 (Chemistry). A man of good humor, conviction and far-reaching enthusiasm, Dr. Pauling speaks in this film of his work in biochemistry, in which he is considered to be one of the world’s leading authorities, of his opposition to atomic explosions, and of his concern for the future of man.

results.title: Interview game: Body language
results.brief_description: Gestures, facial expressions and posture are non-verbal ways of communicating feelings and attitude. How to read and react to body language is the subject of this video. It promotes the kind of people skills needed when conducting or going for a job interview. Factors contributing to successful inteviews which are covered include: preparation, location of the interview, placement of the furniture, note taking and speech patterns.

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”
A factory worker complains to his union delegate when he is required to work overtime at short notice. The film pinpoints the need for the delegate to calm down the union member and sort out the facts before he can discuss the incident with management.

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Caroline Leaf, Veronika Soul, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A freewheeling cinematic experience, this film is the work of two Canadian filmmakers, Caroline Leaf and Veronica Soul who relate their perceptions of each other through their respective animation techniques. Images and words are paired in startling associations. Each does a visual portrait of the other, based on characteristic gestures and impressions. A combination of techniques and materials, including live action, animation, photographs and drawings, produces a film of rich visual texture shaped by the hands and heads of two very different people. (Awards: Varna; Montreal; Grand Prix winner of Melbourne Film Festival 1980.)

results.title: Intersection collision
results.creator_credit: Amir M Karimi and University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center
results.brief_description: Provides information on intersection collision and on safety devices, and procedures that can reduce injuries. Discusses factors associated with door latch failure and motorist ejection, demonstrates the protection provided to motorists by the combined shoulder strap and lap belt, presents preliminary findings on tempered glass breakage, and illustrates car collision deformation and skid patterns.

results.title: Interscan MLS
results.brief_description: In the quest for an international standard Microwave Landing System for aircraft, Australia has developmed Interscan. The CSIRO Division of Radio Physics undertook this development using their knowledge and technology acquired by their pioneering research into radio astronomy. Filmed at Tullamarine Airport, Melbourne.
